column4: Can anyone help me?  I'm very desperately in need...my wireless card (linksys) is based on the atheros chipset, and uses the madwifi drivers.  I've used these drivers under other distributions with no problem, and under Ubuntu they look as though they are working (the card lights up and goes through the proper series of flashes), but although it says it's connected and activated, I can't actually connect to the net!!!
My AP even logs my MAC address as having connected but I still can't get online!!!!
and you have SSID/WEP key set correctly in network-admin?
you sure you're not using MAC address filtering on the AP?>
Yes.  I have checked checked and rechecked.  I use the exact same settings for my g/fs cisco card, and it works fine.
Okay, I set up my AP to give me a static IP, and it still won't work.
and you don't have any ACL or MAC Address filtering?
I also copied and pasted the WEP key from the AP config to my card config
No MAC filtering, I don't think my AP even supports ACL filtering.
Ah.  Then no, absolutely no filtering.
do you have SSID broadcast enabled or disabled?
disable WEP and try again- also SSID's are case sensitive...this is just to test
